post.description: This endpoint takes an input obect with a user question, context and options and returns a response object

requestBody.description: The request object.  Must include the question and a context.

post.summary: Categorize text into an Intent & Category
post.description: Categorize text into an Intent & Category

topIntents.description: If Vector Similarity is set as the Intent Match type, this will provide the top 3 matches

post.summary: Explore with NTL or a template
post.description: Freeform prompting using NeuralSeek Template Language

input.description: The text, including NTL, to evaluate.  Include either this or templateName

templateName.description: The templateName to use. Include either this or input

params.description: An array of parameters to use in evaluation of the NTL

streaming.description: Return the response via SSE streaming.  This is not compatible with most Virtual Agent platforms, and is intentded for direct website use.

llm.description: Override the LLM load balancer and force seek to use a specific LLM.  Input the LLM code here.  You must have a valid model card set up on the configure tab for the code you input.

user_id.description: Set the user_id. Useful and required if you have a corporate document filter set

temperatureMod.description: Shift the model's baseline temperature weighting by a percentage

toppMod.description: Shift the model's baseline probability weighting by a percentage

freqpenaltyMod.description: Shift the model's baseline frequency penalty weighting by a percentage

minTokens.description: Set the minimum tokens you  want the model to produce

maxTokens.description: Set the maximum tokens you  want the model to produce

returnVariables.description: Return the final state of all variables in a dense object

returnVariablesExpanded.description: Return the final state of all variables in the same format as the input params

maxRecursion.description: The maximum number of recursive calls to Explore.  Use caution that you have not created an endless loop as you increase the maximum, as each Explore is charged.

render.description: The steps used to render the result.

chained.description: True if the step is chained

variablesExpanded.description: The returned variable, in the format of the input params

text.description: The text to extract entitites from

language.description: The 2-char language code to be used when generating a promptEntity response. Only set this if you want to override the configured language in NeuralSeek.

entities.description: An array of objects, stringified. The properties of the object are name, description, and format

slots.description: Provide an object of variable names, with a type property set to an entity type to match to in total across multiple turns of a conversation. NeuralSeek will return a promptEntity to display to the user to continue to fil the slots.  As slots are filled the value field will be populated.  Continue to send this entire filed back as input thru the multiple turns of the conversation, untill Complete is set to true.  Complete will be set to true when all slots are filled
slots.example: {"zip": {"type": "zip-code", "description":"The user's zip code", "value": ""}, "statenm": {"type": "geo-state", "description":"The state you are traveling to", "value": ""}}

confirmSlots.description: When using Slots, once all slots have been filled display a summary and ask for a confirmation before setting the 'complete' flag

confirmEverySlot.description: When using Slots, on every turn recite the slot that was just previously filled.

complete.description: If slots are passed, complete will be set to true when all slots are filled

promptEntity.description: A message to display to the user asking them to provide input for the next group of unfilled slots.

slots.description: If the slots parameter is filled on the input, NeuralSeek will return it and begin filling the value fields. Continue to send this entire filed back as input thru the multiple turns of the conversation, untill Complete is set to true.  Complete will be set to true when all slots are filled
slots.example: {"zip": {"type": "zip-code", "description":"The user's zip code", "value": "06111"}, "statenm": {"type": "geo-state", "description":"The state you are traveling to", "value": ""}}

post.summary: Translate text into a desired language
post.description: Translate text into a desired language

text.description: An array of input text to be translated

model_id.description: Convienence input for legacy connections. Define a traget language by setting a source to target relationship using 2-digit language codes, for example en-es to translate into spanish.  The source language is ignored. Either this or the target parameter is required.

target.description: The 2-digit language code for the target language.  Either this or the model_id parameter is required. Valid values are: en, aa, ab, ae, af, ak, am, an, ar, as, av, ay, az, ba, be, bg, bh, bi, bm, bn, bo, br, bs, ca, ce, ch, co, cr, cs, cu, cv, cy, da, de, dv, dz, ee, el, en, eo, es, et, eu, fa, ff, fi, fj, fo, fr, fy, ga, gd, gl, gn, gu, gv, ha, he, hi, ho, hr, ht, hu, hy, hz, ia, id, ie, ig, ii, ik, io, is, it, iu, ja, jv, ka, kg, ki, kj, kk, kl, km, kn, ko, kr, ks, ku, kv, kw, ky, la, lb, lg, li, ln, lo, lt, lu, lv, mg, mh, mi, mk, ml, mn, mr, ms, mt, my, na, nb, nd, ne, ng, nl, nn, no, nr, nv, ny, oc, oj, om, or, os, pa, pi, pl, ps, pt, pt-br, qu, rm, rn, ro, ru, rw, sa, sc, sd, se, sg, si, sk, sl, sm, sn, so, sq, sr, ss, st, su, sv, sw, ta, te, tg, th, ti, tk, tl, tn, to, tr, ts, tt, tw, ty, ug, uk, ur, uz, ve, vi, vo, wa, wo, xh, yi, yo, za, zh, zh-cn, zh-tw, zu, pt-br, zh-cn, zh-tw

detected_language.description: The 2-digit language code for the detected language.

schema.description: The input text to identify the language of

language.description: The 2-character language code of the identified language.

confidence.description: The confidence of the language identification.

post.summary: Find PII in a user utterance
post.description: Find PII in a user utterance

text.description: The user utterance to check for PII

post.description: Allow users to give feedback in on answers generated

score.description: The rating score. An integer, 0-5. 0 is worst, 5 is best.  For Thumbs up / Thumbs down send 0 or 5

post.summary: Get the user ratings for an answer
post.description: Get the user ratings for an answer

score.description: The average score for the answer.

total.description: The total number of user ratings for the answer.

post.summary: Run the Semantic Scoring model on text against an array of passages
post.description: Run the Semantic Scoring model on text against an array of passages

requestBody.description: The request object.  Must include the question and a context.

passages.description: The rating score. An integer, 0-5. 0 is worst, 5 is best.  For Thumbs up / Thumbs down send 0 or 5

requestBody.description: The request object.  Must include the question and a context.

train.description: The training token. Get this from passages/train

requestBody.description: The questions csv.  Must adhere to the template https://api.neuralseek.com/qa.csv After upload you will receive a 202 response and the server will begin processing.  Check for your completed results on the getTestResults endpoint.

get.description: Retrieve an results from the test endpoint

post.description: Retrieve an analytics dataset for your instance

requestBody.description: The request object.  You may optionally limit the result set using "count"

count.description: The number of rows to return

limit.description: The number of rows to return, max of 100

skip.description: The number of result sets to skip for paging

delete.description: This endpoint deletes all user data

parameters.name: intent
parameters.description: The intents to delete. If left blank all intents will be deleted.

session_id.description: A session identifier for the defined user.

user_session.description: Context tracking object. You must set at least one of user_id or session_id to enable context keeping.

personalize.description: An object that allows NeuralSeek to tailor a response for a specific user

preferredName.description: The name the user should be referred to by

noWelcome.description: The user has already been welcomed, do not re-welcome.  Valid value is 'true' or 'false'.  Default value is 'false'.

forceFirstPerson.description: Use a first-person speaking style, even if no preferredName is set.  Valid value is 'true' or 'false'.  Default value is 'false'.

products.description: An array of products this customer currently consumes from your company

additionalDetails.description: Additional details to pass to language generation

override.description: Override all settings by passing a NeuralSeek configuration.  Pass the full and exact text in a NeuralSeek configuration .dat file

streaming.description: Return the response via SSE streaming.  This is not compatible with most Virtual Agent platforms, and is intentded for direct website use.

seekLLM.description: Override the LLM load balancer and force seek to use a specific LLM.  Input the LLM code here.  You must have a valid model card set up on the configure tab for the code you input.

language.description: Valid values are: en, xx, aa, ab, ae, af, ak, am, an, ar, as, av, ay, az, ba, be, bg, bh, bi, bm, bn, bo, br, bs, ca, ce, ch, co, cr, cs, cu, cv, cy, da, de, dv, dz, ee, el, en, eo, es, et, eu, fa, ff, fi, fj, fo, fr, fy, ga, gd, gl, gn, gu, gv, ha, he, hi, ho, hr, ht, hu, hy, hz, ia, id, ie, ig, ii, ik, io, is, it, iu, ja, jv, ka, kg, ki, kj, kk, kl, km, kn, ko, kr, ks, ku, kv, kw, ky, la, lb, lg, li, ln, lo, lt, lu, lv, mg, mh, mi, mk, ml, mn, mr, ms, mt, my, na, nb, nd, ne, ng, nl, nn, no, nr, nv, ny, oc, oj, om, or, os, pa, pi, pl, ps, pt, pt-br, qu, rm, rn, ro, ru, rw, sa, sc, sd, se, sg, si, sk, sl, sm, sn, so, sq, sr, ss, st, su, sv, sw, ta, te, tg, th, ti, tk, tl, tn, to, tr, ts, tt, tw, ty, ug, uk, ur, uz, ve, vi, vo, wa, wo, xh, yi, yo, za, zh, zh-cn, zh-tw, zu, pt-br, zh-cn, zh-tw

filter.description: Text to use as a filter against the filter field set in the KnowledgeBase configuration. Use commas to separate multiple strings for an 'or' filter. You can use the filter to isolate a certain subset of documents in the knowledgebase.

company.description: The company or Brand.  If bias is enabled, bias will be towards this thing.

enabled.description: Enable the semantic Score model.  Valid values are the strings 'true' and 'false'

primary.description: Use the Semantic Score for minimum and warning confidence thresholds.  Valid values are the strings 'true' and 'false'

lastTurn.description: lastTurn is a flexible object. It is backwards compatible with the original single turn object, as well as compatible with the Watson Assistant session history format.

response.description: The system response.  Text strings only here.

pullToCompany.description: Enable company bias.  Valid values are the strings 'true' and 'false'

promptEngineering.description: Enable Prompt engineering.  Valid values are the strings 'true' and 'false'

promptEngineeringPhrase.description: Prepend a phrase to cleansed user input. Must enable Prompt Engineering inside the NeuralSeek "Configure" page

warnConfidenceText.description: Text to prepend on warning confidence levels

minConfidenceText.description: Text to respond with for blocked minimum confidence responses

misTolerance.description: Misinformation Tolerance. A whole number from 0 to 100

sensitiveText.description: Text to respond with for blocked sensitive responses

minText.description: Text to respond with for blocked minimum word responses

maxWords.description: Text to respond with for blocked maximum word responses

maxWordsNumber.description: A whole number from 1 to 100.  100 is unlimited.

answerLength.description: The verbosity of the answer. A whole number 1-4

url.description: URL of the current page when using with a web-based Virtual Agent

stump.description: Stump Speech text. Fallback for when all else fails.

includeSourceResults.description: Include generation source results. Defaults to false.

includeSourceResultsFormatted.description: Include generation source results, and output them into a formatted string.  Defaults to false.

sourceResultsNumber.description: When including source results, how many to include.'

sourceResultsSummaryLength.description: When including source results, how long of a summary to include.'

options.description: Optional object for runtime override of Seek options.

answerId.description: The id of the answer. Use this to refer to it from other endpoints, such as the Rating endpoint

thumbs.description: The URL of a rating SVG to embed with the answer to allow easy rating.

category.description: The category id of the answer.

categoryName.description: The category name of the answer.

score.description: The final confidence score of the answer (0-100)

KBscore.description: The KnowledgeBase confidence of the answer's source documentation  (0-100)

cachedResult.description: If the result came from cache, will be set to the string 'true'

langCode.description: The language code of the answer. If you set the input language code to 'xx' to identify the language, this is useful to condition of the found language and response.

url.description: The top scoring URL (if available) used to train the answer. Set the field you want returned here in on the Configure tab. The field must contain a URL, or it will be ignored.

document.description: The top document (if available) used to train the answer. Set the field you want returned here in on the Configure tab

sourceResultsFormatted.description: A listing of the passages used for answer summarization. This will only return if includeSourceResultsFormatted is set to true on the request

passages.description: A listing of the passages used for answer summarization. This will only return if includeSourceResults is set to true on the request

passage.description: The passage text, summarized to the length set by sourceResultsSummaryLength

id.description: The id of the source document in the KB.

url.description: The URL (if available) of the source document.

document.description: The name of the source document.

train.description: The training token for the document. Use this when calling the /train endpoint.

kbCoverage.description: KnowledgeBase coverage score. How much content was returned from the KnowledgeBase on the subject asked as compared to benchmarks. Low coverage is not necessarily indicitive of bad content.
